example: I want scrambled eggs for breakfast.
description: Prato feito com ovos batidos cozidos em uma frigideira.

example: No way! That can't be true.
description: Expressa descrença ou negação forte.

example: The landscapes in that region are breathtaking.
description: Geralmente usado para descrever a aparência natural de um lugar.

example: I went back to the office after lunch.
description: Usado para dizer que retornou a um lugar onde já esteve.

example: I’m back from my vacation.
description: Usado para indicar que alguém retornou.

example: I’ve been pretty busy this week with work.
description: Expressa que alguém está com muitos compromissos ou tarefas.

example: This way, follow me!
description: Usado para indicar uma direção.

example: The meeting today was pretty crazy, lots of unexpected issues.
description: Pode ser usado para descrever situações intensas ou absurdas.

example: Are you coming to the meeting? — For sure!
description: Usado para afirmar algo com certeza.

example: I take notes during every meeting to stay organized.
description: Escrever pontos importantes para não esquecer depois.

example: In March, I'll travel to a town in the countryside.
description: Região rural ou fora dos grandes centros urbanos.

example: This city has many beautiful spots to visit.
description: Pode se referir a lugares interessantes ou pequenas áreas.

example: He became a couch potato after losing his job.
description: Alguém que passa muito tempo sentado, geralmente assistindo TV.

example: A sedentary lifestyle can lead to health problems.
description: Refere-se a alguém ou algo com pouca atividade física.

example: Building a career is a long journey.
description: Pode ser usada tanto para viagens quanto trajetórias pessoais/profissionais.

example: I need a nap after lunch.
description: Um curto período de sono, geralmente durante o dia.

example: I even know how to fix the issue, but I didn’t have time.
description: Expressa conhecimento inesperado ou adicional.

example: I work on Mondays as well.
description: Usado para adicionar algo similar ao que já foi dito.

example: He plans to take over his father's business next year.
description: Assumir controle ou responsabilidade sobre algo.

example: I'm so mad right now. | He's mad about sports.
description: Pode significar raiva ou obsessão, dependendo do contexto.

example: We always have fun during the team-building activities.
description: Desfrutar de algo de forma alegre e relaxada.

example: We explored several new ideas during the meeting.
description: Investigar ou conhecer algo a fundo.

example: Jack passed away yesterday morning.
description: Uma forma mais suave de dizer que alguém morreu.

example: I got there just in time. | She got there before everyone else. | We finally got there after a long trip.
description: Expressão usada para indicar que alguém chegou a um lugar específico.

example: I'm afraid I can't help you. | I'm afraid of spiders. | She's afraid to talk in public. | I was afraid of the dark when I was a child. | They were afraid they had lost the keys.
description: É um adjetivo e usamos com o verbo to be.

example: He fears losing his job. | She feared she would fail the test. | I fear we are too late. | My biggest fear is losing someone I love. | I have a fear of flying.
description: Pode ser substantivo ou verbo.

example: If you do it that way, it will be much easier.
description: No final da frase.

example: He has been ill for a week. | She felt ill after eating the seafood. | The patient is seriously ill.
description: Mais grave

example: I feel sick today. | He was sick with the flu. | She stayed home because she was sick.
description: Mais leve

example: I'm staying home for now. | That's enough for now. | We're using this tool for now, but we might change it later. | Let's keep this process as it is for now and review it next month.
description: Usado para indicar algo temporário ou provisório.

example: It is annoying. | This noise is so annoying! | He's always interrupting me. It's really annoying. | It's annoying when people talk loudly during meetings.
description: Algo ou alguém que causa irritação ou incômodo.

example: I carry my bag to work every day. | She always carries a water bottle. | He carried the boxes to the car. | I always carry my laptop to meetings.
description: Significa carregar, levar consigo, ou transportar algo de um lugar para outro.

example: I seek new opportunities in my career. | They sought medical help immediately. | She is seeking advice from her mentor. | He seeks justice. | We're seeking a solution to improve productivity.
description: Passado [sought]. Usado para objetivos, ajuda, justiça, soluções, etc.

example: He pounded on the door until someone answered. | He pounded the door with his fist (punho). | The waves were pounding the shore (costa). | My heart was pounding before the big presentation.
description: No sentido de bater repetidamente com força, como na porta ou o coração acelerado.

example: She let out (deu) a deep sigh when she heard the news. | He sighed in relief after finishing the report. | The manager sighed when the deadline was missed again.
description: Soltar um suspiro, geralmente por cansaço, alívio ou frustração.

example: I didn't realize how late it was. | I just realized I left my phone at home. | She didn’t realize he was joking. | We realized the system had a bug after the update.
description: Se dar conta de algo, perceber algo que não era óbvio antes.

example: Can you remind me to call my friend later? | She reminded him about the meeting. | This song reminds me of my childhood. | Please remind the team to submit their reports.
description: Lembrar alguém de algo.

example: What a surprise! | She looked surprised when she got the promotion. | They surprised me with a birthday cake at work. | I was surprised by the results of the meeting.
description: Pode ser usada como substantivo (surpresa) ou verbo (surpreender).

example: Her kindness towards strangers is truly inspiring.
description: Atitude de ser gentil, atencioso ou prestativo com os outros. Envolve gestos de carinho, empatia ou ajuda.

example: He holds an apple. | He is holding an apple. | She held my hand tightly. | This bottle holds (contém) two liters of water.
description: Passado [held]

example: She dressed quickly in the morning. | I usually dress before breakfast. | She dressed the baby in warm clothes.
description: No sentido de vestir uma roupa ou vestir em alguém

example: The police uncovered (descobriu) new evidence during the investigation. | The journalist uncovered (revelou) a major corruption scandal.
It sounds strange to me. | That music sounds (soa) beautiful. | You sound tired. | It sounds like a good idea.
description: No sentido de parecer pelo tom da voz

example: You seem tired today. | It seems like he’s not coming. | She seemed very happy at the party.
description: No sentido de dar a impressão de algo pelo jeito, olhar, postura, etc.

example: Over the last week, I've worked a lot. | Things have changed over the weeks. | We've made progress over the weeks.
description: [Over the...] indica um período de tempo contínuo. Exemplo: over the day, over the month, over the years.

example: She feels confident about the presentation. | He is confident in his skills. | You need to be confident during job interviews.
description: Ter certeza ou acreditar em si mesmo ou em algo.

example: The first attempt failed. | He made an attempt to fix the bug. | It was her third attempt at the test.
description: Uma tentativa de fazer algo, especialmente algo difícil.

translation: Notar | Prestar atenção a algo | Perceber | Aviso (substantivo)
example: I didn't notice you were here. | Did you notice the new painting on the wall? | She received a notice about the meeting.
description: Também pode significar um aviso formal ou uma notificação.

example: She baked a cake for the meeting. | I love to bake cookies on the weekend. | We baked some bread together.
description: Cozinhar algo no forno usando calor seco.

translation: Deixado para trás | Ficar para trás
example: They left me behind. | I forgot my phone and left it behind. | Many employees feel left behind during fast tech transitions.
description: Usado quando algo ou alguém não acompanha o restante ou é esquecido.

example: I don't live with greed. | There's no greed in my life. | Greed can destroy a good team environment.
description: Desejo excessivo de ter mais (dinheiro, poder, bens), sem se importar com os outros.

example: Make sure the table is even before placing the vase. | The workload should be even among team members.
description: Algo que está nivelado, estável ou igual.

example: He didn't even say goodbye. | She didn't even try. | I can't even imagine that happening.
description: Usado para enfatizar surpresa, contraste ou intensidade.

example: The company needs to even out its expenses. | Let’s even out the workload between the teams. | The paint will even out as it dries.
description: Tornar algo mais equilibrado ou regular.

example: I'm grateful for your help.
description: Usado para expressar sentimento de gratidão.

example: I grew up in a small town. | She grew up in New York. | We grew up together.
description: Usado para falar sobre onde você passou sua infância ou se desenvolveu.

example: Everyone deserves a chance to be born free. | It's a miracle to be born.
description: Expressão usada para indicar o ato de vir ao mundo.

example: I was born in Brazil. | I was born in 1990. | I was born on a rainy day.
description: Forma no passado da expressão 'be born', usada para dizer quando e onde você nasceu.

example: The baby will be born next month. | Many stars are born in galaxies. | A new idea was born from that discussion.
description: Usado para indicar o momento em que alguém ou algo surge (pessoas, ideias, etc).

example: I wake up at 7 AM every day. | I wake up feeling tired sometimes. | Do you wake up early on weekends?
description: Acordar do sono, abrir os olhos.

example: I get up after I wake up. | He gets up and goes straight to the gym. | I don't get up early on Sundays.
description: Sair da cama, levantar-se fisicamente.

example: She walked towards the door. | His attitude towards me has changed. | The car was heading towards the city.
description: Usado para indicar direção física, atitude ou movimento em relação a algo ou alguém.

example: She is a great singer. Moreover, she is a talented dancer. | The project is delayed, and moreover, we are facing budget issues.
description: Usado para adicionar uma informação que reforça ou complementa o que foi dito anteriormente, geralmente em contextos mais formais.

example: I didn't recognize her at first. | Can you recognize this place? | He recognized the song as soon as it started playing.
description: Usado para indicar que você identifica alguém ou algo porque já viu, ouviu ou experimentou antes. Também pode significar admitir algo como verdadeiro ou importante.

translation: Esforçar-se | Lutar por algo com dedicação
example: She strives to be the best in her field. | We must strive for a better future.
description: Usado quando alguém se empenha intensamente para alcançar algo difícil ou importante.

example: It's important to be truthful in all situations. | She gave a truthful version of what happened.
description: Descreve alguém ou algo que fala ou mostra a verdade, sem enganar.

example: You need to own up to your mistakes. | He finally owned up to breaking the vase.
description: Expressão usada quando alguém admite responsabilidade por algo errado ou ruim que fez.

example: Our goals align with yours. | The wheels need to align properly. | The company's mission aligns with its values.
description: Usado para indicar que algo está em harmonia ou alinhado com outra coisa, como ideias, objetivos ou estratégias.

example: The investigation is still ongoing. | The task is ongoing. | We have an ongoing project with them.
description: Algo que está acontecendo no momento e ainda não foi finalizado.

example: The elderly need special care. | She works at a home for the elderly. | An elderly man helped me cross the street.
description: Usado como adjetivo ou substantivo para se referir a pessoas de idade avançada. Muitas vezes aparece com o artigo 'the' para indicar o grupo em geral (the elderly = os idosos).

example: Can you lend me a pen? | I lent him some money last week. | She lent her book to a coworker. | I can lend you my charger during the meeting.
description: Dar algo temporariamente a alguém com a expectativa de que será devolvido.

example: I was looking forward to this moment. | We are looking forward to meeting you. | I'm looking forward to the company retreat. | She's looking forward to her vacation next week.
description: Expressão usada para mostrar entusiasmo ou expectativa por algo futuro.

example: She struggled to lift (levantar) the box. | They are struggling with financial problems. | She is struggling to finish her homework. | I’ve been struggling with this problem for days.
description: Usado para descrever quando alguém passa por algo difícil ou se esforça muito para alcançar algo.

example: Would you like anything else? | Is there anything else I can do for you? | I don’t think there’s anything else to discuss.
description: É comumente usada para perguntar se há mais alguma coisa ou se alguém precisa de algo mais.

example: The park is over there. | You can find the restaurant over there, near the corner. | I saw him over there, talking to someone.
description: É uma expressão que indica um lugar distante de quem está falando, geralmente em uma direção específica.

translation: O que mais... | Mais o que...
example: What else do you need from me? | What else can we do to help? | What else happened at the meeting?
description: É uma expressão usada para perguntar se há mais alguma coisa, ou para pedir informações adicionais sobre algo.

example: This is indeed a great opportunity. | It was indeed a beautiful ceremony. | Indeed he did. | She's smart, and indeed, one of the best students in the class. | Indeed. But we can handle it.
description: Usado para reforçar ou confirmar uma declaração anterior.

example: We ran out of milk. | Hurry up, we're running out of time! | She ran out of gas on the way home. | They ran out of tickets for the concert.
description: Geralmente usada quando algo está prestes a ou já acabou, como recursos, suprimentos ou tempo.

example: The party was over by midnight. | The meeting was over after an hour. | His time in the city was over. | Her vacation was over, so she had to go back to work.
description: Usado para indicar que algo foi concluído ou terminou. Pode ser usado em diversos contextos, como eventos, atividades, sentimentos...

translation: Estava fora | Estava ausente | Estava indisponível
example: I tried to call him, but he was out. | The store was out of the item I wanted. | The power was out for several hours. | She was out of the meeting yesterday.
description: Expressa que algo ou alguém não estava presente ou disponível em um momento específico.

example: The company provides free Wi-Fi. | Can you provide more details? | This service will provide assistance to those in need.
description: Usado quando se oferece ou disponibiliza algo para alguém, como ajuda, informações ou recursos.

example: I'll be ready in a couple of minutes. | It will only take a couple of minutes. | Wait here for a couple of minutes, please.
description: Expressão informal que significa 'alguns minutos'. Usada para indicar um curto período de tempo.

example: She’ll be back in a couple of weeks. | I’ve been waiting for a couple of weeks. | It might take a couple of weeks to finish the project.
description: Expressão comum usada para indicar duas ou algumas semanas aproximadamente.

example: I will finish this task within an hour. | The package will arrive within three days. | There is a gas station within 5 kilometers. | She acted within the law.
description: Usado para indicar um limite de tempo, distância ou espaço dentro do qual algo acontece.

example: I was very tired yesterday. Besides that, I had a lot of work to do. | The hotel was too expensive. Besides that, the service was terrible. | I don’t like coffee. Besides that, I prefer tea in the morning.
description: Expressão usada para adicionar uma informação extra ou destacar outro ponto relevante.

example: You deserve a break after working so hard. | She deserves recognition for her dedication at work. | They didn’t deserve that kind of treatment from their manager.
description: Usado para dizer que alguém é digno de algo, geralmente por mérito ou esforço.

example: Your behavior in the meeting wasn’t acceptable. | They showed strange behavior during the project. | She has difficult behavior when working under pressure.
description: Refere-se à maneira como alguém age, especialmente em situações sociais ou profissionais.

translation: Lidar com | Resolver | Enfrentar algo ou alguém
example: I have to deal with a lot of emails every day. | She knows how to deal with difficult coworkers. | How do you deal with stress at work?
description: Expressão usada para indicar que alguém está enfrentando, resolvendo ou administrando uma situação ou pessoa.

example: I regret my decision to leave the company. | She regrets not applying for the promotion. | His biggest regret is not taking that job opportunity abroad.
description: Como verbo, significa sentir arrependimento. Como substantivo, pode ser usado como 'arrependimento'.

example: It was nice to meet you. – Likewise! | He was frustrated with the delay, and she felt likewise. | You should take breaks during the day. Likewise, avoid working overtime too often.
description: Usado para expressar que algo também se aplica ou é igualmente verdadeiro.

example: Are you from around here, or did you relocate for the job? | I asked my new coworker: 'Are you from around here?'
description: Pergunta usada para saber se a pessoa mora ou trabalha na região onde a conversa está acontecendo.

translation: Levantar | Erguer | Aumentar | Criar | Educar | Aumento (substantivo)
example: Please raise your hand if you have a question during the meeting. | They decided to raise the subscription price. | She raised her children while managing a team. | He got a raise after his performance evaluation.
description: Pode ser verbo ou substantivo. Como verbo, significa fazer algo subir (como preços, voz, mão). Como substantivo, significa um aumento (geralmente de salário).

example: There are endless emails in my inbox every morning. | We had an endless meeting yesterday. | The project seems to have endless revisions.
description: Usado para descrever algo que parece não ter fim, como tarefas, reuniões ou filas.

translation: Mais | Além disso | Além do mais
example: I have a meeting at 3 PM, plus (além disso) I need to reply to some emails. | Five plus three equals eight. | This new software has great features, which is a big plus (grande vantagem) for the team.
description: Pode ser usado como preposição (mais), conjunção (além disso), adjetivo (positivo) ou substantivo (vantagem).

example: Technology evolves rapidly. | People evolve over time. | The company evolved into a global brand.
description: Verbo usado para indicar desenvolvimento gradual ou progresso ao longo do tempo.

translation: Subir | Crescer | Aumentar | Levantar-se | Nascer (Determinados Contextos)
example: The sun rises in the east. | Prices rose last year. | He has risen to the challenge.
description: Verbo irregular: Rise, Rose, Risen. Usado quando algo sobe ou se eleva por conta própria, sem agente externo.

example: There are many threats in this area. | The country faces new security threats. | Online threats are becoming more common.
description: Substantivo no plural. Refere-se a situações, pessoas ou ações que representam perigo ou risco.

example: The economy is full of uncertainties. | We must be ready to face uncertainties. | Life is full of uncertainties.
description: Substantivo plural que indica falta de certeza ou previsibilidade sobre algo.

example: We live in an ever-changing world. | Technology is an ever-changing field. | She adapted to the ever-changing environment.
description: Adjetivo composto usado para descrever algo que está em constante transformação.

example: She received a reward for her honesty. | Hard work brings great rewards. | They rewarded him with a promotion.
description: Pode ser usado como substantivo ou verbo. Refere-se a algo dado em reconhecimento a um esforço, conquista ou comportamento.

translation: Através de... | De um lado para o outro... | Do outro lado...
example: She walked across the street. | They swam across the river. | There's a supermarket across the road. | My best friend lives across the street. | The bird flew across the sky. | We traveled across the country by train. | I saw someone waving across the window.
description: Pode ser usado como preposição ou advérbio. Indica movimento de um lado para o outro ou localização do outro lado de algo.

example: Based on a true story. | Based on true events. | The company is based in New York.
description: Com base ou baseado em algum lugar.

term: I have been with them for about five years now
translation: Eu estive com eles há 5 anos.

example: My Pleasure (Muito pazer)

description: Usamos esse termo quando alguém espirra. Em português geralmente usamos [saúde]

translation: Conversando de maneira informal ou descontraída
example: We were chatting about our plans for the weekend. | I had a nice chat with my friend yesterday.
description: Verbo chat

example: Something unexpected may arise during the meeting. | He arose early to catch the first train. | Problems arise when people don't communicate well. | Problems arise when people don't expect.
description: Algo que começa a acontecer geralmente de maneira inesperada.

example: Her insightful analysis helped us understand the situation better. | He has an insightful look at marketing.
description: Significa algo que demonstra uma compreensão profunda e clara sobre algo, ou que oferece uma perspectiva perspicaz.

translation: Obrigado por me receber | Obrigado por me convidar

term: I have a background in sales and marketing
translation: Eu tenho experiência com vendas e marketing.

example: The company is leveraging (aproveitando ao máximo) its (sua) technology to improve customer service. | She is leveraging her network to find new business opportunities. | They plan to leverage their expertise in marketing to expand their business. | The company plans to leverage its new technology to expand its market share.
description: Usar algo (como recursos, habilidades ou influências) de forma eficaz para alcançar um objetivo, muitas vezes com o intuito de maximizar resultados.

example: There are various options available for the project.

term: I'm a firm believer in continuous learning
translation: Sou um firme defensor do aprendizado continuo.

example: Her efforts to help the community are truly commendable. | he team's performance in the tournament was commendable. | They are commendable for what they made.

translation: Algo que acontece de forma inesperada ou repentina
example: The sudden change in weather surprised everyone. | There was a sudden loud noise outside the window.

translation: É usado para indicar que algo aconteceu de forma rápida e inesperada
example: Suddenly, the lights went out. | Suddenly, she realized she had forgotten her keys. | The weather turned suddenly, and it started to rain.

translation: Se aproximar de algo ou alguém | Abordar
example: She decided to approach the situation with a calm mindset. | We should approach this project with a more organized strategy. | We need to approach this problem carefully. | His approach to teaching is very effective.

translation: Adequação de uma pessoa a uma função

example: You can go to the party, as long as you finish your homework first. | I will help you, provided that you ask politely (educadamente). | You can join the team, as long as you are committed to the project. | He will attend the meeting, provided that he finishes his report on time.
description: Podemos usar [as long as] ou [provided that]

example: He worked hard to attain success in his career. | She attained the highest score in the class. | The company aims to attain a 10% growth in sales this year.
description: Attained - passado

example: I fall when I run too fast. | He fell down the stairs. | Every autumn, the leaves fall from the trees. | She fell off the bike when she tried to jump the ramp.
description: Fell - passado

example: She engages with her audience by asking questions. | The students engaged in a deep discussion about climate change.
This new software enhances productivity in the workplace. | Good lighting enhances the beauty of a room. | Regular practice enhances your chances of success.

Innovative strategies help drive growth in the technology sector. | nvesting in digital marketing can drive growth for small businesses. | New technologies drive growth by increasing efficiency and reducing costs.
She enjoys working in a fast-paced (dinâmico) environment. | The movie had a fast-paced (acelerado) plot that kept the audience engaged.
A rainbow appeared after the rain.
The magician made the rabbit disappear.
I have finished my homework, but everything else can wait. | She bought the dress, but everything else was too expensive.
She is a kind person who always helps others. | It was very kind (gentil) of you to help me with the project.
She gave me a warm hug when I arrived.| I need to warm up my coffee, it's getting cold. | The fireplace will warm the entire room.
The bright light hurt my eyes. | She has a bright future ahead of her. | The room is bright and welcoming.
She always has a cheerful attitude. | The cheerful music made everyone smile.
I ate the whole cake by myself. | She spent the whole day reading. | The whole team was excited about the victory.
Each student must submit (entregar) their assignment (tarefa) by Friday. | I gave each of my friends a gift for their birthday.
I decorated my bathroom yesterday.
The pillow (travesseiro) is very soft, so I sleep well. | She has a soft voice that calms everyone around her. |
I love to hug my friends when I see them. | She gave me a warm hug after the long journey. | He needs a big hug to feel better.
He gave me a tight hug before leaving. | Make sure (certifique-se) the screws (parafusos) are tight so the shelf doesn’t fall.
We decided to put off the meeting until next week. | The rain put off our plans for a picnic. | She was put off by his rude behavior.
I fell in love with her the moment I met her. | He fell in love with the city during his vacation. | She fell in love with the idea of traveling the world.

translation: Descreve a ação de fazer algo de maneira alta ou ruidosa, com um volume elevado.
example: She sang loudly during the concert. | He laughed loudly when he heard the funny story.
Don’t shout at people for no reason! | She shouted for help when she saw the fire.

translation: Andar ou viajar em algo, geralmente um veículo ou animal
example: She loves to ride her bike in the park. | We will ride horses through the mountains. | He was riding his motorcycle when it started to rain.
Although it was raining, we went for a walk. | She is very talented, although she is still learning. | Although he was tired, he finished the project on time.
description: É usada para introduzir uma ideia contrastante ou contraditória em relação à ideia principal da frase.

example: She was the most qualified candidate; therefore, she got the job. | The weather was bad, therefore the event was canceled. | He didn't study for the test; therefore, he didn't pass.
description: É usado para indicar uma consequência ou conclusão com base em algo previamente mencionado.

example: We walked through the park on our way home. | She looked through the window and saw the rain. | The project took a long time to finish, but we got through it (finalizá-lo).
Nowadays, many people prefer to work from home. | It's hard to find a good job nowadays. | Nowadays, we have access to information instantly through the internet.
description: É usado para se referir ao tempo presente, especialmente em comparação com o passado.

example: I suppose we could try that new restaurant tonight. | Do you suppose he will be there ? | I suppose she has already left the office.
description: É utilizado quando queremos expressar algo que acreditamos ser verdadeiro, mas sem ter certeza absoluta.

translation: Avaliação | Exame | Análise de algo especialmente para medir seu valor, qualidade ou desempenho.
example: The teacher gave us an assessment at the end of the semester. | The company's financial assessment shows positive growth. | I will need an assessment of your skills before deciding.

translation: Dirigir-se para algum lugar | Liderar algo
example: We headed (fomos) to the beach early in the morning. | She headed (liderou) the marketing team for five years. | After dinner, they headed (foram) home.

translation: Se arrastar. | Demorar mais que o esperado.
example: The meeting dragged on for hours. | The movie was interesting at first, but then it dragged on. | Their argument dragged on for weeks without a resolution.
At first, I found the new job difficult, but now I enjoy it. | She didn’t like the city at first, but she got used to it. |

You should sleep at least eight hours a night. | It was raining, but at least we had umbrellas. | He didn’t win the race, but at least he finished it. | At first, we planned to travel by car, but we decided to fly instead.
By the way, have you seen my keys ? | I love this restaurant. By the way, their pizza is amazing ! | By the way, I won’t be able to attend the meeting tomorrow.

translation: Desistir | Abrir mão | Parar de tentar
example: I won’t give up on my dreams. | He gave up smoking last year. | Don’t give up! Keep trying.
This test was really tough (difícil). | She is a tough (forte) woman who never gives up. | The steak was too tough (duro) to eat.
description: Tâf

example: She always encourages her friends to follow their dreams. | Teachers should encourage students to ask questions. | My parents encouraged me to try new things.
Despite the difficulties, she remained calm. | I will remain here until you come back.
I heard a buzz in my ear when I was near the beehive (colmeia). | There was a lot of buzz about the new movie release. | There’s always a buzz at the office when a big project is about to start.
description: Pode ser usado como substantivo ou verbo e tem diferentes significados. Pode se referir a um som contínuo (como o de uma abelha), uma sensação de energia ou excitação, ou até a um burburinho sobre algo.

example: It's a joy to see tou again. | She was filled with joy when she received the good news. | The children's laughter brought joy to everyone in the room. |

translation: Parecer | Ter aparência de algo ou alguém
example: She looks like her mother. | The sky looks like it's going to rain. | That new restaurant looks like a great place to eat.
The company will release the new product next month. | The movie will be released in theaters this summer.

translation: Preencher | Encher | Acrescentar algo a um espaço vazio
example: Please fill out the form with your personal details. | She filled the glass with water. | The manager asked me to fill in (substituí-lo) for him during his absence.
description: Substituir alguém temporariamente [fill in]. Preencher formulários, documentos ... [fill out]

example: She was afraid that the truth would be exposed during the trial. | The documentary exposes the impact of climate change on the environment. | The investigation will expose the company's unethical (antiética) practices. | Exposure (exposição) to the sun for too long can expose your skin to harmful (nocivos) effects.
Please go away, I'm busy right now. | She told him to go away after the argument (discussão). | The kids went away for the weekend to visit their grandparents.
description: [Go away] tende a ser mais direto e usado para pedir que alguém se afaste de maneira imediata, enquanto [Leave] é mais neutro e usado para indicar a ação de sair, sem a mesma ênfase em afastamento.

example: The company hired a new manager last week. | She was hired as a software developer. | We need to hire more staff for the project.
description: Geralmente usado em contexto de trabalho

example: He drives carefully to avoid accidents. | She avoided talking about the argument. | I always avoid him at work. | She crossed (atravessou) the street to avoid the crowd (multidão). | He avoided making eye contact with her.
description: Tomar medidas para impedir que algo aconteça ou para não entrar em contato com algo ou alguém.

example: The company will deploy (implantar) a new security system next week. | The army deployed (posicionar) thousands of soldiers to the border. | We need to deploy (implantar) the latest version of the app today.
The forest soundscape at night is filled with the sounds of crickets and owls. | The city's soundscape includes car horns, people talking, and distant music.

translation: Conquistas | Realizações | Feitos alcançados por meio de esforços
example: Winning the championship was one of his greatest achievements. | She takes pride (se orgulha) in her academic achievements. | The scientist’s achievements in medicine saved many lives. | The scientist’s achievements in medicine saved many lives.
The necklace is adorned with beautiful gems. | That book is a hidden gem; not many people know about it. | She is one of the gems of the company, always bringing innovative ideas.
She has read countless books.

translation: Passo | Etapa | Medida (ação tomada para alcançar algo)
example: She took a step forward and opened the door. | Learning a new language is a step-by-step process. | The company took an important step toward sustainability.
She stretches every morning to stay flexible. | The road stretches for miles ahead. | He tried to stretch the budget to make it last longer (duasse mais).
I am stuck in traffic.
I cherish our friendsship. | I will always cherish the memories of my childhood. | She cherishes the time spent with her family. | He cherished every moment of his life.
He leads the team with great dedication. | The teacher leads the students in various activities. | He led the team to victory last year. | She led the discussion during the meeting.
description: Passado é [led]

translation: Vagar | Perambular | Andar sem rumo | Divagar
example: He loves to wander through the city at night. | My mind tends to wander when I'm bored. | She spent hours wandering in the park.
description: O passado é [wandered]

example: She turned the key in the lock to open the door. | The weather can turn cold in the evening. | If you turn left at the traffic lights, you'll find the café. | The leaves turned yellow in the fall.

translation: Para dentro de algo | Transformar-se em algo | Indicar uma ação ou direção que leva a algo
example: She jumped into the pool. | He put his keys into (dentro) his bag. | Are you going into the store now ? | He didn’t get into the university he wanted.
She sat on the couch (sofá), munching on popcorn while watching a movie. | The rabbit was happily munching on a carrot. | He munched on an apple as he read his book.
His eye twitched from exhaustion. | She felt a twitch in her hand after holding the heavy bag for too long. | The cat twitched its tail before jumping.
description: De forma involuntária ou de maneira curta e abrupta.

example: I decided to switch my phone for a newer model. | Can you switch to another TV channel ?

translation: Correr rapidamente, avançar em alta velocidade.
example: He dashed to catch the last train. | She dashed into the room with exciting news.
She basked in the warm sunlight (sol quente) on the beach. | He basked in the glory of his achievement.
description: Desfrutar de algo bom ou Aquecer-se ao sol ou ao calor

example: The star was glowing. | The fireflies (vagalumes) glowed in the dark. | Her face glowed with happiness. | The city skyline (horizonte da cidade) glowed under the sunset (por do sol).
The cat is under the table. | She is under a lot of stress at work. | Children under 12 get a discount.
description: Posição física abaixo de algo (debaixo de, sob). | Estar submetido a uma condição ou influência. | Menos que um determinado número ou valor (abaixo de)

example: The lamp is hanging (pendurada) over the table. | He jumped over the fence. | There were over 50 people at the party. | The game is over.
description: Posição acima de algo | Movimento de um lado para outro | Quantidade maior que um determinado número ou valor | Encerramento ou término de algo

example: She whispered a secret in my ear. | They were whispering during the meeting. | The wind whispered through the trees.
He stumbled on a rock while walking in the park. | She stumbled into the room after drinking too much. | I stumbled over my words during the presentation.
That movie was so funny! I couldn't stop laughing. | There's something funny about this situation. | He told me a funny joke at the party.
She loves to cuddle with her cat on the couch. | The baby cuddled his teddy bear while sleeping. | hey cuddled under the blanket (cobertor) to stay warm (ficar aquecido)
Do you have any further question ? | We need to walk further (mais distante) to reach the village. | Do you need further information about the project ? |
She is an excellent student. Furthermore, she always helps her classmates. | The project is behind schedule. Furthermore, we are running out of budget. |
We finally reached the hotel after a long trip. | She reached her goal of becoming a doctor. | I don’t think it’s a good idea. Furthermore, it could be risky
We will leave in a little while. | She said she would call me back in a little while. | Dinner will be ready in a little while.
description: Usado para indicar que algo acontecerá em um curto período de tempo. (um período mais curto que [soon]

example: Can you explain this math problem to me ? | She explained the rules before the game started. | He had to explain why he was late for the meeting.
She greeted her guests with a warm smile. | He greeted me by shaking my hand. | The teacher greeted the students as (quando) they entered the classroom.
description: Usado para descrever o ato de saudar alguém de maneira amigável, seja com palavras, gestos ou expressões.

example: She loves to solve riddles in her free time. | Can you guess the answer to this riddle ? | The ancient book was full of riddles and secret messages.
She was worried about the test results. | Don’t be worried, everything will be fine. |
description: Sentir ansiedade, inquietação ou apreensão sobre algo que pode acontecer. | He looked worried when he heard the news.

example: I disagree with you on this topic. | They often disagree about politics. | We can disagree and still be friends.
description: Passado [disagreed]
Passado [agreed]

example: Don't leave (deixe) your phone on the table. | My flight leaves at 8 AM. | He left his jacket in the car.
description: Passado [left]

translation: Apressar-se | Agir rapidamente | Fazer algo com urgência
example: Hurry up! (apressa-se!) The movie is about to start. | She hurried to catch the last bus. | We need to hurry or we will miss our flight. | I was hurrying to finish my work before the deadline.

translation: O dia inteiro | Durante todo o dia.
example: I've been working all day long. | She was singing all day long. | It rained all day long yesterday. | The kids played outside all day long.
She is proud of her achievements. | I'm so proud of you! | They felt proud after finishing the project. | He walked into the room with a proud smile.

translation: Estar atrasado ou se atrasando para um compromisso
example: I'm running late for work! She was running late, so she took a taxi. | Sorry, I'm running late. I'll be there in 10 minutes. | We can't stop now. We're already running late!
Even when it's hard, you have to keep going. | She kept going despite all the challenges. | Don't stop now! Keep going until you finish. | If you keep going in this direction, you'll reach the park.

translation: De tempo em tempo | Ocasionamente | De vez em quando
example: I like to go hiking from time to time. | She calls her grandmother from time to time. | From time to time, we all need a break. | He visits his hometown from time to time.
I'll be more careful next time. | Next time, don’t forget to call me. | She promised to arrive on time next time. | Next time we meet, let’s go for coffee.

translation: Há pouco tempo | Não faz muito tempo
example: I saw her not long ago. | Not long ago, we moved to a new house. | He started his new job not long ago. | Not long ago, people didn't have smartphones.

translation: Você decide | Depende de você | A escolha é sua
example: Where do you want to go for dinner ? It's up to you! | You can stay or leave, it's up to you. | Whether we take the train or drive is up to you (depende de você). | It's up to you to make the final decision.

translation: Boa ideia | Bem pensado | Bom raciocínio | Boa Sacada
example: You brought an umbrella ? Good thinking ! It might rain later. | Good thinking! We should double-check (conferir) the numbers before submitting the report. | She suggested making a backup copy of the files. Good thinking! | Good thinking, taking a shortcut! We arrived much earlier.
Please double-check your answers before submitting the test. |

Please double-check your answers before submitting the test. | I always double-check my work to avoid mistakes. | She double-checked the schedule to make sure nothing was missed. | Don't forget to double-check the ingredients before baking the cake.
description: Passado [double-checked]

example: Who cares what they think? Just do what makes you happy! | It's raining, but who cares? We can still have fun! | She said I was late, but who cares? It was just a few minutes. | I forgot to bring my notebook, but who cares? I can take notes on my phone.
I'm sorry, I overreacted to the situation. | He always overreacts when things don’t go his way. | Try not to overreact to small mistakes.
description: Passado [overreacted]

example: Frankly, I don't like this idea. | She spoke frankly about her concerns (preocupações). | Frankly, I expected better from you.
description: Pode ser também [Honestly]

example: That's not fair! You got more than me. | The judge made a fair decision.
I went to bed late last night. | She works late on Fridays.
I'll call you later. | See you later! | She arrived later (mais tarde) than expected. |
Can I borrow your pen ? | She borrowed a book from the library. | He borrowed some money from his brother. | I borrowed a dress from my friend for the party.
The bank loaned me $10,000. | I took out a loan (empréstimo) to buy a car. | The student loan (empréstimo estudantil) will take years to pay off (quitar). | We got a car loan (financiamento de carro)
description: Usado mais para dinheiro e bens de alto valor

example: I just wanted to say hello, that's all (só isso). If you don't want to go, just tell me. That's all (isso é tudo) I need to know. | I ordered a coffee and a sandwich, that's all.
You can rely (confiar) on me if you need help. | She relies (depende) on her parents for financial support. | I don’t rely (dependo) on luck; I work hard to achieve my goals.

translation: Qualquer um (de dois) | Também (em frases negativas)
example: You can take either road; both lead to the city. | I don’t like coffee. I don’t like tea either (também). | Either you apologize, or we can’t be friends anymore. | There are two options, but either (qualquer uma) choice will work.
You need to act fast in an emergency. | She wants to act in movies. | His kind act helped many people.

translation: Do que | A partir do que | Pelo que
example: From what (pelo que) I heard, the meeting was canceled. | From what I can tell, he is not interested. | From what I remember, she used to live here. | From what you said, it sounds like a great idea.
Time will heal your wounds (feridas). | His broken leg took months to heal. | She needed time to heal after the accident.
Don't be so silly! | She told a silly joke that made everyone laugh. | I made a silly mistake on the test. |  That movie was so silly (sem sentido), but I enjoyed it.

translation: Pensar demais | Pensar excessivamente | Procupação excessiva
example: Stop overthinking and just make a decision. | Overthinking can make simple problems seem much bigger. | She spent the whole night overthinking what he said. | Overthinking often leads to unnecessary stress.
Stop overanalyzing every little detail. | He tends to overanalyze social situations and gets nervous. | She spent hours overanalyzing his text message.

I thought the movie would be boring, but actually, it was really good. | He looks serious, but he’s actually very funny. | I don’t actually like coffee, I just drink it for the caffeine. | Did you actually read the entire book?
She wrapped the gift in colorful paper. | He wrapped his arms around her.
She reads a book every night. | Every student must complete the test. | I go to the gym every Monday and Wednesday. | Every detail matters in this project.
It doesn’t matter to me. | Health matters more than. | This is a serious matter. | Water is a liquid matter (matéria líquida).

You need to have a growth mindset (mentalidade de crescrimento) to keep improving. | His positive mindset helped him overcome (superar) many difficulties. Changing your mindset can change your life. | She has a strong business mindset.
description: Refere-se à forma como uma pessoa encara desafios, oportunidades e a vida em geral.

example: He managed to overcome his fear of public speaking. | With determination, she overcame all the difficulties. | They overcame the crisis with teamwork and perseverance.
He spent a large amount of money on his new car. | You need a small amount of sugar for this recipe. | The amount of time we have is limited. | She was surprised by the amount of work she had to do.
description: Geralmente usado para algo incontável, como dinheiro, tempo ou esforço.

example: I aim to improve my English. | They are aiming for first place in the competition. | The company aims to provide high-quality service.
description: Passado (aimed)

example: He gave me a shifty look (olhar suspeito). | I don’t trust him, he seems shifty.
We need to shift (mudar) our strategy. | She works the night shift.
Do you have any proof of your claim (alegação) ? | The fingerprints were solid proof of his presence at the crime scene.
He pushed (empurraram) the door open. | She pushed the button to call the elevator. | She is pushing herself (se esforçando) to study harder. | They pushed (pressionaram) him to take the job.
She pulled the door open. | He pulled his phone out of his pocket. | The new movie is pulling a lot of attention. Can you pull the chair closer to the table ? | The dog pulled on the leash.
We should embrace new challenges with confidence. | He embraced the idea of working remotely. | We should embrace change instead of fearing it (temê-la).
I spent the entire day studying. | She ate the entire cake by herself. | The entire team worked hard to finish the project. | This is the best movie I’ve seen in my entire life!
description: Ele é usado para indicar que algo está completo, sem partes faltando.

example: Make sure you lock the door before leaving. | I need to make sure everything is ready for the meeting. | Make sure to bring your ID to the airport. | She made sure everyone understood the instructions.
description: ...que algo aconteça ou seja feito corretamente | Menos formal que o [ensure that]

example: I covered my mouth when I sneezed. | She covered the cake with chocolate. | I cover my bike with a tarp when it rains. | She always covers her books with plastic. | This insurance covers all medical expenses
Don’t blame me for your mistakes ! | She always blames her brother when something goes wrong. |  They blamed the weather for the flight delay. | I blamed myself for not studying enough.
description: Culpar ou responsabilizar alguém por algo ruim que aconteceu. | Pode ser [culpado] também

example: They tried to shame her for her choices. | The teacher shamed him in front of the whole class. | Don’t shame people for making mistakes.

translation: Vergonha de uma pessoa ou situação | Pena | Tristeza
example: She felt deep shame for what she had done. | It’s a shame you couldn’t come to the party | There’s no shame in asking for help.
He's too lazy to clean his room. | I had a lazy Sunday, just watching movies. | She gave a lazy excuse for being late. | Stop being lazy and do your homework !

We need to ensure that all data is protected. | We need to ensure that everyone has access to clean water. | Please ensure that all doors are locked before leaving. | The new software update ensures better security for users.
description: Mesmo significado que [make sure], só que mais formal e usado em contextos profissionais

example: This tarp is yellow
She gets jealous when he talks to other girls. | He's jealous of his brother's success. | Don't be jealous! You will have your turn. | They had a jealous argument (discussão por ciúmes) last night.
description: Significa ciumento ou invejoso, dependendo do contexto.

example: You should treat others with respect. | The doctor treated her injury immediately.
description: Como substantivo pode ser agrado, presente ou recompensa.

example: I don’t know whether I should go or stay. | She asked me whether I preferred coffee or tea. | Let me know whether you’ll come. | I’ll go to the party whether or not it rains.
description: Geralmente é usado quando há duas ou mais alternativas. (Formal) | Em alguns casos, [whether or not] é usado para enfatizar que algo acontecerá independentemente da escolha

translation: Comprometer-se | Dedicar-se | Cometer (crime, erro ou ato) | Destinar
example: She committed herself to the project. | If you want to succeed, you must commit to your goals. | He committed a serious mistake. | The company committed more resources to the project.
I'll prepare dinner. Meanwhile, you can set the table. | She was waiting for the doctor. Meanwhile, she read a magazine. | He started a new job. Meanwhile, his wife was finishing her degree.
description: É um advérbio usado para indicar que duas ações acontecem ao mesmo tempo ou que algo ocorre enquanto outra coisa está acontecendo.

example: I always begin my day with a cup of coffee. | She began learning French last year. | The movie had already begun when we arrived.
description: Begin, Began and Begun

example: The manager dismissed two employees yesterday. | She dismissed his suggestion without even considering it. | The teacher dismissed the class early today.

translation: Preocupação | Interesse | Preocupar (Verbo) | Afetar (Verbo) | Dizer respeito a algo (Verbo)
example: This issue concerns (diz respeito) everyone in the company. | Her health concerns me (me preocupa) a lot. | The rules concern (diz respeito) all employees. | There is growing concern (preocupação) about climate change. | Education should be a bigger concern (preocupação) for the government.

This is a serious issue that needs to be solved. | The article discusses social (questões sociais) issues. | There was an issue with my internet connection. | The government will issue (emitirá) new ID cards next year. | The bank issued (emitiu) a new credit card for me. |
The flight was delayed due to bad weather. | She was absent (ausente) due to illness (doença).

He is a very handsome man. | Her brother is tall, strong, and handsome. | That’s a handsome house you have! | He received a handsome (generosa) reward for his work. | She donated a handsome amount to charity (caridade).
description: Usado para descrever um homem de aparência agradável e charmosa.

example: Despite the rain, we went to the park. | She passed the test despite feeling nervous. | Despite his efforts, he couldn't finish the project on time. | Despite trying hard, he failed the exam.
description: É usado para indicar que algo aconteceu apesar de outra coisa, sugerindo um contraste.

example: Even though it was raining, we went for a walk. | She smiled even though she was feeling sad. | Even though I tried my best, I didn't win the competition. | He went to the party even though he was tired. | Even though the movie was long, I enjoyed it.
description: É usado para expressar uma ideia de contraste, geralmente introduzindo uma condição que não impede que a ação principal aconteça.

example: I wanted to go to the park; however (no entanto), it started raining. | The movie was very long. However, it was interesting. | I studied a lot. However, I didn't pass the exam.
description: É comumente usado para mostrar uma contradição ou oposição em relação ao que foi dito anteriormente.

example: My grandmother is very wise. She always gives good advice. | It was a wise decision to save money for the future.

You need to behave yourself in class. | The children were told to behave during the party. | He didn't behave well at the meeting. | Please behave! | She behaved well at the party. | She always behaves politely with others.
description: É usado para descrever a maneira como alguém age ou se comporta, especialmente em termos de boas maneiras, disciplina ou respeito.
Passado [donated]

example: My grandmother is very wise. She always gives good advice.
How long does it take to learn english ? | How long does it take to get to Rio ?
I felt relieved after hearing the good news. | She was relieved to find her keys. | They seemed relieved when the meeting ended.
He hit the ball very hard. | I accidentally hit my head on the door. | We hit our sales target (meta de vendas) this month. | Hit the button to start the game. | The song is a big hit
description: Substântivo [acerto, sucesso, pancada] | Como verbo (presente, passado e particípio são iguais): Hit, Hit, Hit

example: I unintentionally hurt his feelings. | She unintentionally deleted the file. | He made an unintentional mistake during the meeting.
You have to face your fears. | She faced many challenges in her career. | We are facing a serious problem.
She poured water into the glass. | Rain poured down all night.
She waved goodbye to her friends as they left. | He waved his hand to get her attention. | She is waving at us from across the street.
The box is very heavy. | It was a heavy decision to make. | The heavy rain caused flooding. | There was a heavy fog this morning.
description: Adjetivo

example: I was shocked when I heard the news. | She was shocked by the sudden change in plans. | They were shocked by the accident. | The news left me completely shocked.

translation: Uma expressão informal e vulgar usada para descrever algo que é falso, enganoso ou sem sentido
example: He told me that story, but I think it's just bullshit. | This excuse is total bullshit! | You really believe that? That's pure bullshit.

translation: Mergulhar | Mergulhar de cabeça em algo (contexto figurativo)
example: He dove into the pool to cool off. | Let's dive into this problem and find a solution. | She decided to dive into the new project without hesitation.
description: Passado [dove]

example: Can you spell your name for me ?

translation: É um adjetivo usado para descrever algo que é complicado, difícil ou envolve desafios.
example: The test was tricky, but I managed to finish it. | It was a tricky situation, and I wasn't sure what to do. | The second problem was trickier (comparativo) than the first. | This is the trickiest (superlativo) part of the project.
I scheduled a meeting for Friday. (Verb)| The event is scheduled to start at 3 PM. (Verb) | My schedule is full today. (Subs) | What’s your schedule for tomorrow ? (Subs)
description: Como substântivo [Significa agenda, cronograma, programação, ou horário.]

translation: Olhar rapidamente para algo ou alguém.
example: She glanced at her watch and realized she was late. | He glanced around the room but didn’t see anyone he knew. | I glanced out the window and saw it was raining.
I feel uneasy about this decision. | He gave her an uneasy smyle.
description: Adjective

example: Please, sit down. | She sat on the chair. | They are sitting on the couch. | Can I sit here ?
description: Sit - Sat - Sat

translation: Indica que algo ou alguém não estava mais presente, já tinha partido ou desaparecido.
example: When I arrived, she was gone. | The money was gone when I checked my wallet. | By the time we got there, the bus was gone.
description: Was gone é uma expressão em inglês que usa o passado do verbo [to go] no particípio (gone)

translation: Olhar fixamente ou encarar algo ou alguém por um longo período de tempo, geralmente de forma intensa.
example: She stared at the painting for a long time. | He stared at her without saying a word. | Don't stare at people, it's impolite.

description: [Impolitely]
[Politely]

translation: É um [Gesto] ou [Movimento] feito com as mãos
example: She made a gesture of agreement by nodding her head. | He gave a welcoming gesture to the guests. | The teacher used a gesture to tell the students to be quiet. | When he saw her, he gestured to her.
description: Geralmente para expressar uma ideia, emoção ou comando sem usar palavras. | O verbo [Gesture] também pode ser usado para significar fazer um gesto (gesticular).

example: After the test results came back negative, she felt a great sense of relief. | He sighed with relief when he found his lost wallet.

translation: Cercar | Envolver algo ou alguém de todos os lados
example: The police surrounded the building to catch the criminal. | We were surrounded by beautiful mountains during our hike. | The city is surrounded by a large forest.
I accidentally dropped my phone. | The temperature will drop overnight (durante a noite).

translation: Bater palmas ou aplaudir | Dar um tapinha ou bater algo
example: The audience clapped after the performance. | She clapped her hands to get everyone's attention. | We clapped for the team after they won the match. | He clapped his friend on the back to congratulate him.
description: Passado [clapped]

example: I don't like these guys, but I conceded and bought their course. | He conceded access rights to the website for all employees. | (After the long negotiation, the company finally conceded a salary increase to the employees.
description: Passado [conceded]

example: The music is too loud. | He spoke in a loud voice. | Don't be so loud!
description: Usado para descrever sons ou vozes com barulhos elevados

example: I always laugh at his jokes. | She laughed out loud. | His laugh (risada) is contagious. (Subs)
I'm unsure about what to do next.
description: Usado quando alguém não tem certeza sobre algo, como uma decisão, situação ou informação. Refere-se à dúvida ou hesitação.

example: He feels insecure about his English pronunciation.
description: Usado quando alguém sente falta de confiança, geralmente relacionado à autoestima, aparência ou habilidades. Tem um tom mais emocional.

example: My room is a mess. | After the party, the kitchen was a complete mess. | The situation turned into a mess quickly.
description: Pode ser usada para falar de lugares desorganizados, situações complicadas ou até problemas pessoais.

example: She gathered flowers in the garden. | He gathered information for the report. | They gathered (se reuniram) for dinner.. | I gather (eu deduzo) that you’re not happy with the decision.
Please don't touch the screen. | She touched his arm gently. | Try not to touch anything in the museum. | He has a magic touch with animals. (Subs)
description: Pode servir também como substântivo

example: He gave me a sly smile when he told the joke. | She has a sly way of getting what she wants. | The sly fox tricked the rabbit into falling into the trap.
description: Usado para descrever alguém que age de maneira dissimulada, secreta ou astuta, geralmente com intenções de enganar.

example: They fell for a scam and lost all their money. | This is a scam website; don’t trust it.

translation: Vítima de golpe ou fraude | Enganado ou Fraudado
example: She was scammed by a fake lottery email. | I can’t believe I was scammed out of (e perdi) my money!

translation: Desperdiçar (Verbo) | Usar algo de maneira ineficiente (Verbo) | Desperdício (Subs)
example: Don't waste your food. | I wasted my time watching that movie. | There's a lot of waste (desperdício) in the kitchen. (subs) | he company is focused on reducing waste. (subs)
description: Pode ser usado como substântivo

example: I want to purchase a new laptop. | They purchased tickets for the concert. | The purchase of the house took several months. (subs) | I made an online purchase last night. (subs)
description: Também funciona como substantivo. | É mais formal que [buy], mas significam a mesma coisa

example: When you smile, the whole world smiles with you. | She has a beautiful smile. | He smiled when he saw the message.
description: Pode ser usado como verbo (sorrir) ou substantivo (sorriso). Expressa felicidade, gentileza ou simpatia.

example: I will set the table for dinner. | She set the alarm for 7 a.m. | I bought a new set (conjunto) of knives. (subs)

translation: Aborrecido (Adj) | Chateado (Adj) | Chatear (Verb) | Perturbar (Verb) | Reviravolta - Surpresa Inesperada (Subs)
example: She was upset (chateada) after the argument. | I feel upset (chateado) about the situation. | I didn’t mean to upset (chatear) you. | The news upset (perturbou) him a lot. | It was a big upset (reviravolta) when the team lost.
description: Pode ser adjetivo, verbo [upset - upset - upset] e substantivo.

example: I can handle this situation. | She handled the problem very well. | He knows how to handle difficult customers. | Be careful when you handle fragile objects. | This machine is easy to handle.

translation: De alguma forma. | De algum jeito
example: Somehow, we managed to finish the project on time. | I don't know how he fixed the computer, but somehow it works now. | She somehow knew I was lying. | Somehow, I need to do it by tomorrow morning. | She loves him somehow.
description: É um advérbio usado quando você não sabe exatamente como algo aconteceu ou vai acontecer, mas aconteceu ou acontecerá.

translation: She is inside the house. (prep) | The inside of the box is empty. (adj)
description: Pode ser preposição, adjetivo ou advérbio

example: I fix computers. | I fixed my car yesterday. | Can you fix this bug ? |
I need to repair my car. | The technician repaired the computer. | My phone is in repair. | The house needs a lot of repairs.
description: [Repair] soa um pouco mais formal e técnico do que [Fix]

example: I hope to find my keys. | I want to find the car there. | I find (considero) that alarm very annoying. | I found that movie boring.
description: No sentido de achar ou localizar

example: You won’t get the report done unless you start now. | I can’t approve the budget unless the manager reviews it first. | Unless we fix this bug, the system will crash again.
description: Usado para indicar uma condição negativa – algo só acontece se determinada condição não for atendida.

translation: Seguir em frente | Passar para outra coisa
example: Let’s move on to the next topic in the meeting. | It’s time to move on from that old project. | After the layoff, he decided to move on and look for new opportunities.
description: Usado para indicar a ideia de deixar algo para trás e seguir com a vida, tarefas ou assuntos.

example: Please add a label to each document. | Don’t label people based on one mistake. | The product was returned because it had the wrong label.
description: Pode ser usado como substantivo (rótulo, etiqueta) ou como verbo (rotular, classificar algo ou alguém).

example: The company culture helps shape employee behavior. | Her experience abroad shaped her leadership style. | The design is still taking shape.
description: Como substantivo, refere-se à forma de algo. Como verbo, indica o ato de moldar ou influenciar algo ou alguém.

example: From today on, we’ll have daily stand-up meetings. | From today on, you’re responsible for the client reports. | I’ll work on my communication skills from today on.
description: Expressão usada para indicar que algo começa agora e continuará no futuro.

example: Even if the deadline is tight, we must deliver. | I’ll attend the meeting even if it’s after hours. | She keeps working hard, even if no one notices.
description: Usado para falar sobre uma condição que pode acontecer, mas não muda o resultado ou a atitude.

example: The update wasn’t perfect, but it worked anyway. | I didn’t get the promotion, but I’ll keep trying anyway. | Anyway, let’s get back (voltar) to the agenda (pauta).
description: Usado para continuar uma ideia, mudar de assunto ou mostrar que algo será feito independentemente de obstáculos.

example: The server went down, so we lost some data. | She was so tired after the presentation. | So, let’s begin the project review.
description: Pode ser usado para indicar consequência, ênfase (muito) ou para introduzir uma ideia.

example: He works too much. | I want to attend the conference too. | This report is too long to finish today.
description: Usado para indicar excesso (demais) ou adicionar algo (também).

example: Her belief in the team’s potential helped them succeed. | It’s important to respect different beliefs in the workplace. | The manager’s belief that everyone can improve changed the company culture.
description: Refere-se a algo que uma pessoa acredita ser verdade, seja uma ideia, opinião ou valor pessoal ou coletivo.

example: Can't complain. | He’s always complaining about the workload (carga de trabalho). | If you have a problem, you should complain to HR.
description: Usado para expressar insatisfação com algo. Pode se referir a situações pessoais, profissionais ou cotidianas.

example: Can someone else handle this task? | I thought you were someone else. | Someone else will join the meeting later.
description: Expressão usada para se referir a uma pessoa diferente da que está sendo mencionada ou com quem se está falando.

translation: O que quer que | Qualquer que seja | Tanto faz
example: Whetever! (tanto faz) | You can choose whatever you want. | Whatever decision you make, I’ll support you. | We’ll do whatever is necessary to finish this project.
description: Usado para indicar que qualquer opção ou escolha é válida. Também pode ser usado para enfatizar indiferença, dependendo do tom.

translation: O que for preciso | O que for necessário
example: We’ll do whatever it takes to meet the deadline. | She’s willing (disposta) to do whatever it takes to get the promotion. | Our team is ready to make it happen, whatever it takes.
description: Expressão usada para indicar que a pessoa está disposta a fazer tudo o que for necessário para alcançar um objetivo.

example: I'll send the report as soon as I finish it. | Please call me as soon as you arrive. | As soon as the meeting ends, let’s discuss the next steps.
description: Expressão usada para indicar que uma ação acontecerá imediatamente depois de outra.

example: We’re going through a difficult time at work. | She went through all the reports before the meeting. | He went through a lot last year. | She goes through a tunnel every day.
description: Usado para descrever o ato de enfrentar uma situação difícil, revisar cuidadosamente algo ou experimentar uma série de eventos.

example: Let's split the bill. | They split the work between them. | The class was split into groups.
description: Usado para indicar a divisão de algo em partes ou entre pessoas. Pode ser usado em contextos financeiros, tarefas, grupos etc.

example: Let's wrap up the meeting. | We need to wrap this up before lunch. | She wrapped up her presentation in 5 minutes.
description: Expressão usada para encerrar ou concluir algo, como uma reunião, atividade ou apresentação.

example: I completed the task yesterday. | She completed her training successfully. | He finally completed the form.
description: Usado para indicar que algo foi finalizado ou concluído com êxito.

example: They lack confidence. | I lack the time to help. | There is a lack of resources.
description: Pode ser usado como verbo para indicar ausência de algo, ou como substantivo para indicar escassez.

example: Can you summarize the article? | He summarized the main points. | Let me summarize what we've learned.
description: Usado para expressar a ação de apresentar algo de forma mais curta e direta, destacando os principais pontos.
